_description: A Charm against Toothache — twenty-one couplets

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Thre gude breþer are ȝeGud gatis gange ȝehaly
                    thynges seke ȝehe says will ȝe telle me…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…Gretly athe suere ȝe meBy mary modir mylke so
                    fre
Lincoln91.Note:
Nineteenth-century transcription is London,  British Library Egerton 2257, f.
                    98.
Lincoln91.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Derek Stanley,  and  A. E. B. Owen.  
             “Introduction.” 
             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
         London: Scolar Press, 1975.
Lincoln91.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas,  and  James Orchard Halliwell-Phillipps, eds.  
             Reliquiae Antiquae.
         2 vols. London: Smith, 1845: 1.126-7.
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 1.375.
Hughes,  Muriel Joy. 
             Women Healers in Medieval Life and Literature.
         Salem, NH: Ayer, 1943; repr. 1991: 32.
